title: Bill of Rights Day, 2025
summary: This proclamation, Bill of Rights Day, 2025, by President Donald J. Trump, commemorates the 250th anniversary of American independence and the ratification of the Bill of Rights. It highlights the Bill of Rights as a foundational document enshrining freedoms like speech, worship, bearing arms, protection against unlawful arrest and seizure, fair trial, and freedom from cruel punishment. The proclamation emphasizes that these rights are sustained by American principles such as the separation of powers, due process, checks and balances, states' rights, and a virtuous citizenry. The President asserts his administration's commitment to guarding these freedoms, restoring the rule of law, and ensuring that Washington answers to the American people. The document calls for appropriate ceremonies and activities to mark Bill of Rights Day.
